author: Pavan Dahat
text:
The Chhattisgarh Pradesh Congress Committee (PCC) on Wednesday expelled former Chief Minister Ajit Jogi’s son and Marwahi MLA Amit Jogi for six years from the primary membership of the party for his “involvement” in “fixing” a by-election last year.

“Ajit Jogi and Amit Jogi’s name appeared in the recently surfaced audio tapes regarding the dealings to make Congress candidate withdraw from the Antagad bypoll last year. The incident has dented the party’s image,” read a resolution passed by the PCC on Wednesday.

“We have also recommended to the AICC that Ajit Jogi be expelled from the party for six years,” Chhattisgarh Congress president Bhupesh Baghel told reporters at a press conference here.

The Jogis were served a notice by the PCC after the alleged leaked tapes of their purported conversation to fix Antagad by-polls surfaced a week ago. The father-son duo had submitted their response to the PCC.

Amit Jogi called his expulsion a “win of feudal elements” and a “defeat of Adivasi, Dalits and the poor.”

Senior Congress leader and the Leader of Opposition in Chhattisgarh Assembly Mr. T. S. Singh Deo said the decision would “benefit” the party.

Mr. Ajit Jogi was not available for his reaction as he was “admitted” to a hospital in Raipur for a surgery.
title: Amit Jogi expelled from Congress
